intro: Cyanothamnus fabianoides subsp. roseus, commonly known as the pink everlasting or pink bluebottle, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is a member of the daisy family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are borne in dense, spherical clusters and are visited by various pollinators such as bees and birds. The subspecies roseus is distinguished by its more intense pink coloration compared to other subspecies of Cyanothamnus.
